subject: Re: [junit] Simple JUnit with Annotations not working
msgSnippet: Surikoya, Sounds frustrating.  How are you running the test? David Saff
messageBody:
Surikoya,

Sounds frustrating. How are you running the test?

David Saff

On Tue, Jun 2, 2009 at 3:50 PM, surikoya <surikoya@...> wrote:
> I am trying the new annotations feature of JUnit4.
>
> Here is the program I am working with. I am using ant 1.6.5 and copied junit-4.6-RC1.jar to my <ant_home>/lib directory and put it in the classpath too. When I run the test I get a message which says "No Tests found in AnnotationsTest". Did I miss something basic?
>
> import org.junit.Test;
> import static org.junit.Assert.* ;
>
>
> public class AnnotationsTest {
>
>    @Test
>    public void addition() {
>        assertEquals(12, 7+5);
>    }
>
>    @Test
>    public void subtraction() {
>        assertEquals(9, 12-3);
>    }
> }
>
>
>
>
>
> ------------------------------------

> Yahoo! Groups Links
>
>
>
